folder: Orchard Street & Delancey Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Orchard Street, west side, north from (Nos. 123-25), but not including Delancey to East Houston Streets. Shown is a pushcart market a feature of this east side locality. In fact the street name itself is synonymous with this mercantile endeavor.

About 1910.

Ewing Galloway.

folder: Orchard Street & Delancey Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Orchard Street, north from Delancey Street. The view shows the pushcart peddler's market on Orchard Street.
February 17, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, from a point slightly northward.
March 26, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Orchard Street & Delancey Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Orchard Street, east side, north from but not including Delancey, to and including East Houston Streets. The view shows the pushcarts peddler's market on Orchard Street.

April 28, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Collar buttons and cheap jewelry, being sold by peddler of notions, at Delancey and Orchard Streets.

May 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same; showing a cap and hat vendor on Orchard Street.

May 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

Peddlers--foodstuffs and clothing: The Orchard Street push-cart market, between Delancey and Rivington Streets.

1937-8

Allexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Foodstuffs and Clothing.
